body.p: DingsBums?! can display statistics about the entries in the learning stack. Most of the statistics are static and show the current distribution of entries for a criteria. E.g. the following screenshot shows the distribution of entries over the scores. The more you learn the better your score should become.

figure.alt: screenshot of DingsBums?! showing statistics over the distribution of scores

body.p: To be able to see the evolution of the number of entries and the average score over the learning period a chart with time series statistics can be shown (see below). There are two possibilities to save the current statistics for later comparision in a time series:

ul.li: Save the current statistics whenever you want: use menu Tools -> Save current Learning Statistics.
Save the statistics whenever you quit the program: configure this in the Preferences.

figure.alt: screenshot of DingsBums?! showing timeseries statistics
